result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Answer from Judge authorizing use of 14CF201 bond money in 14CF212 as the cases were combined into one $1500  cast bond.
7/22/14 Letter from Attorney Weber to Judge Boyle regarding preliminary hearing

Defendant Garrett W Garvin in court with attorney Julie Ann Weber.  Defendant Garrett W Garvin in custody.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF79, 14CF201 and 14CF212 called.  Attorney Weber recites agreement.  State relates.  Defense and State waive PSI.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.

14CF79 - Case Dismissed

14CF201 - Waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  The Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given.  Court finds probable cause and binds over.  State will file Information.  Case Dismissed and Read-in

14CF212 - Waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  The Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given.  Court finds probable cause and binds over.  State will file Information.

Count 1 - Guilty plea

The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Court questions defendant.  Court waives PSI.  State relates.  Attorney Weber relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

SW - 3 years Probation - Must report to Probation by 3:00 PM on July 25, 2014
Court costs
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment
Must engage in some sort of support meetings
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold
Must work toward attaining GED
25 days jail - Credit for 25 days
Must submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
Must have no contact with Lorena Benjamin unless she and Probation Agent agree

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
$1500.00 CASH BOND TO COVER BOTH 14CF212 AND 14CF201.

Defendant Garrett W Garvin in court with attorney Julie A Weber who appears by phone.  Defendant Garrett W Garvin in custody.  Joseph M Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF201: State moves to quash warrant. Court quashes warrant. Preliminary hearing on 14CF201 also set for 7/22/14 at 1:45 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
Body only - Wisconsin and adjacent States
